definitions.definition: (heading, physical) To move or be moved into something.
(heading, social) To diminish or be diminished.
To keep out of sight; to suppress; to ignore.

definitions.example: I have sunk thousands of pounds into this project.

definitions.definition: To reduce or extinguish by payment.
To be overwhelmed or depressed; to fail in strength.
To decrease in volume, as a river; to subside; to become diminished in volume or in apparent height.
Caused, by natural or unnatural means, to be depressed (lower than the surrounding area) or submerged
definitions.example: The sunken ship lay at a depth of 100 feet

definitions.definition: (of eyes or cheeks) Seeming to have fallen deeper back into the face due to tiredness, illness, or old age.
definitions.example: She looked old and thin with sunken cheeks and hollow eyes.
